original_solution_mapping.L1: He has 2,000 pounds of fish because 10 x 200 = <<10*200=2000>>2,000
original_solution_mapping.L2: He has enough for 80 customers because 2,000 / 25 = <<2000/25=80>>80
original_solution_mapping.L3: 20 customers go home without any fish because 100 - 80 = <<100-80=20>>20

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5635.
    Returns: the number of customers who will go home without any fish.
    """
    # L1
    num_tuna = 10 # 10 tuna
    weight_per_tuna = 200 # each of which weighs 200 pounds
    total_fish_pounds = num_tuna * weight_per_tuna

    # L2
    pounds_per_customer = 25 # Each customer wants 25 pounds of tuna
    customers_served = total_fish_pounds / pounds_per_customer

    # L3
    total_customers = 100 # 100 customers waiting
    customers_without_fish = total_customers - customers_served

    # FA
    answer = customers_without_fish
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He has {total_fish_pounds} pounds of fish because {num_tuna} x {weight_per_tuna} = <<{num_tuna}*{weight_per_tuna}={total_fish_pounds}>>{total_fish_pounds}
He has enough for {customers_served} customers because {total_fish_pounds} / {pounds_per_customer} = <<{total_fish_pounds}/{pounds_per_customer}={customers_served}>>{customers_served}
{customers_without_fish} customers go home without any fish because {total_customers} - {customers_served} = <<{total_customers}-{customers_served}={customers_without_fish}>>{customers_without_fish}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He has 2000 pounds of fish because 10 x 200 = <<10*200=2000>>2000
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He has enough for 80 customers because 2000 / 25 = <<2000/25=80>>80
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: 90 customers go home without any fish because 100 - 10 = <<100-10=90>>90

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'num_tuna' (value: 10) was used instead of 'customers_served' (value: 80.0).
